summary:
Adds 6 dresses, 5 fans and 5 pairs of shoes to be sold at Radiant Raiment shop in Solitude.
There is also a replacer version for vanilla wedding outfit available.
descriptionHtml:
[size=+1][center][color=#FAEBD7]Update:[/color][/center][/size]

[center][size=+2][b][color=#FFFF00]Concerning permissions: I DO NOT give any permissions for the assets from this mod to be used in any other mods. You can't use this, not until it's fixed. No retextures, no conversions, no mixes. NOTHING. The. End. [/color][/b][/size][/center]
I have stopped giving permissions for this dress mod. The mesh is far from perfect and has many flaws I want to fix, weight paint in particular. The dress is going to be a part of bigger armor and clothes mod I am currently working on and for that new mod I will hopefully fix it, but I am not sure how much time it can take. Please don't waste your and my time and don't PM me with permission requests - they are denied on this page and the will be denied in PM anyway.

[size=+1][b][color=#7CFC00]Concerning comments section:[/color][/b][/size] it is closed, because I don't have the time to reply. Most probably I will open it again, but I can't tell you when. Please do not PM me, I am extremely busy atm, better take the time and READ the description.

[size=+1][b][color=#7CFC00]Mods on the screenshots:[/color][/b][/size] please check out the list with all the mods used on the screenshots at the end of the description page in Thanks and Credits section.

[size=+1][b][color=#7CFC00]Concerning the Update and possible new stuff:[/color][/b][/size]
Standalone version is upgraded to 2.2 all 6 dresses got their first person models fixed and Nostalgia dress Ground Object should now display correctly. Please report if you find any bugs.

- If you're CBBE user check out Wavion2's [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49286/?]Omnisway NPC Clothing Replacer[/url] that includes CBBE BodySlide version of my Wedding Dress.

- If you would like to have UNP Skinny version of the dress check out [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49187/?]BadDragonLord's conversion of Noble Wedding Dress for UNP Skinny[/url]

- My friend [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/6565535/?]ShinglesCat[/url] has released her own retexture of the mod. Click on the images below to check it out!
[center]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49178/?][img]http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3684/10290827146_3df75a381f.jpg[/img][/url][/center]


[center][size=+3][color=#E4D6B9][b]Noble Wedding Dress description:[/b][/color][/size][/center]

[center]Hello folks! It's been a while since I uploaded something on Nexus, so here is a mash-up Wedding outfit I made. The meshes are not mine I merely put them together while learning how to work in Blender. So, it would be wonderful, if you could stop by the original mods' pages (see credits section) to say 'thank you' to the authors of those wonderful mods, whose work I have used.

This mod adds 6 dresses, 5 fans and 5 pairs of shoes to be sold at Radiant Raiment shop in Solitude.
There is also a replacer version for vanilla wedding outfit available in the Optional Files section.

The dress mesh is originally meant for [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/12694//?]E55 body[/url], but it will work with any body that uses vanilla UVs - Vanilla body, CBBE, UNP and so on. The sandals are made for standard [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3666//?]Phygit fem feet[/url], meaning that they will work for most body replacers as well.

Future plans:
- to add new wedding wreath mesh and E55 version of the sandals.
- to add more texture variants to the standalone version of the mod.[/center]

[center][youtube]82OQbaT9rTw[/youtube][/center]
[center]Video by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/6247421/?]dptheslothking[/url][/center]
[center][/center]
[center][size=+3][b][color=#E4D6B9]How to get it in game:[/color][/b][/size][/center]
All the items are sold at Radiant Raiment shop in Solitude. Beware that fans are actually are armor pieces (fan-shield) and therefore you have to have a Merchant perk in the Speech tree to be able to buy them in Radiant Raiment.
If you have conflicting mod installed and the items do not appear in Radiant Raiment inventory you can still get them with the console commands:
Open console by pressing "~" key and type:
[color=#B22222]help "Noble"[/color] including the quotation marks and hit Enter. You will see the ID codes of the items. To get them use the following console command:
[color=#B22222]player.additem [itemID] [quantity][/color] without brackets.

Wedding Dress REPLACER version:
Either make Dark Brotherhood quest [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Bound_Until_Death]Bound Until Death[/url], or use the console commands:

Enter the console by pressing ~ key and type:
player.additem 00088956 01 and hit enter
The dress then will be then added to your inventory.
AND
player.additem 00088958 01 and hit enter
Wedding Sandals will be added to your inventory.

[center][size=+3][b][color=#E4D6B9]Bugs and Incompatibilities:[/color][/b][/size][/center]

- Clipping and stretching of the meshes, which can become even more obvious if the character is using non vanilla animations or poses.

-The white color of the dress sometimes gets very bright in certain lighting conditions or when used with super bright ENB mods.

- Sleeves in the first person do not hold on the different textures that I have assigned to them. Trying to figure out what the problem is right now. If anyone knows the solution - please let me know in comments.

-Standalone version of the mod can conflict with any other mod that changes Radiant Raiment shop inventory. As a result you will not see the dresses for sale in the shop. You can change your load order and load my mod after the mod that causes conflict, or you can use console commands to get the items in game. Please refer to How To Get It in game section for console commands.

- Wedding dress REPLACER version is incompatible with any other mods that alter Skyrim's Vanilla Wedding dress meshes.
It should be fully compatible with NPC's clothes texture overhauls, even if they alter wedding dress textures, the meshes in my mod have their own textures and don't use the vanilla ones.


[center][size=+3][b][color=#E4D6B9]Installation and uninstallation instructions:[/color][/b][/size][/center]

Make your life easy and use NMM! [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/modmanager//?]Get Nexus Mod Manager here[/url]

Manual Installation:
1. Extract the files to a temporary location.
2. Examine the folder structure and make corrections if necessary.
3. Copy files to your Skyrim Data folder
4. Start Skyrim Launcher, click 'Data Files', place a checkmark beside the NobeWeddingDressByUrshi.esp file.

Manual uninstallation - delete the files/folders associated with the mod:


[center][size=+3][b][color=#E4D6B9]Leicensing/Legal:[/color][/b][/size][/center]

Unfortunately I have stopped giving permissions for this dress mod. The mesh is far from perfect and has many flaws I want to fix. The dress is going to be a part of bigger armor and clothes mod I am currently working on and for that new mod I will hopefully fix it, but I am not sure how much time it can take. Please don't waste your and my time and don't PM me with permission requests - they will be denied anyway.

This is mod is Skyrim Nexus Mods exclusive release.
I do NOT give permission for this mod to be uploaded to Steam or anywhere else without my consent.

The assets from this file may not be used, modified or reuploaded under any circumstances without my expressed permission. Under no circumstances is my absence from The Nexus can be interpreted as a permission to use the contents of this upload as resource material.
Thank you.


[center][size=+3][b][color=#E4D6B9]Thanks and Credits:[/color][/b][/size]

and Â ofc for her Skyrim Armor Tutorial Series: [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Creating_an_armour_for_Skyrim._Part_1]Creating an armour for Skyrim. Part 1[/url] and [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Creating_an_armour_for_Skyrim._Part_2]Part 2[/url]; [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Converting_an_armour_to_another_body_for_Skyrim]Converting an armour to another body for Skyrim[/url]
Thanks to Glosshouse team for their beautiful mod [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/12694//?]E55 Female Body Replacer[/url]
Thanks to BB Drac for his tutorials: [url=http://www.birrabrothers.com/drac/index.php?dsps=206]Creating a new armor (body) for Skyrim[/url] and [url=http://www.birrabrothers.com/drac/index.php?dsps=206]Dismember Data for Skyrim[/url]
Thanks to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/5033997/?]VectorPlexus[/url] for the help with Blender and all his advices.
Thanks to KURESE aka NPR for the top meshes from his mod [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/13082]R18Pn 00 - Fiona Armor for UNP by NPR[/url]

Thanks to creators of [url=www.blender.org]Blender[/url]
Thanks to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/6553681/?]Caelrya[/url] and all my Nexus friends for testing the file for me and for making wonderful screenshots.

Thanks to LHammonds for the [url=http://hammondslegacy.com/obmm/tools_readme_generator1.asp]Readme Generator[/url] this file's description was based on.
And last but not least many thanks to the Nexus Network, for providing and maintaining such a great place for modders to share their work.[/center]

[size=+1]If you would like to add an NPC who is wearing this dress to your game check out this mod:
[/size][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/41381/]Mystic Knight Sara - Standalone Follower by StandAlone01[/url]

[center][size=+3][color=#E4D6B9]List of the mods that were used on the images:[/color][/size]
Many thanks to the modders whose works were used on the screenshots to my mod!

author: Urshi

Added Wedding Snadals meshes and ground model.
Fixed alpha transparency for the top.
